backend/main.mo: Empty Motoko actor placeholder with no implemented logic.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing responsive layout and table improvements with associated files, components, tests, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries describing various frontend files including styles, configuration, utilities, hooks, and UI components.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base styles with light/dark OKLCH theme variables and global background/foreground definitions.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point loading Leaflet assets, setting metadata, and mounting the React app via main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root app component providing theme support and rendering the EarthquakeDashboard page.
frontend/src/components/earthquake/Dashb: Displays three summary cards showing total events, above-threshold count, and largest magnitude quake using stats props.
frontend/src/components/earthquake/Earth: Modal dialog showing detailed earthquake info with optional moment tensor data and dynamic fetching of event details.
Leaflet map component rendering earthquake markers filtered by map bounds with debounced updates and click callbacks.
Renders a virtualized table of earthquake events with selectable rows, magnitudes, and metadata. Uses a custom virtualization hook for performance on large datasets.
frontend/src/components/earthquake/FeedA: Provides UI controls for selecting time window, minimum magnitude, search query, and refreshing earthquake data.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches a backend actor tied to the user's identity and invalidates dependent queries when it changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Manages Internet Identity authentication, storing identity state and providing login and logout helpers.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Placeholder module indicating USGS data fetching occurs elsewhere.
frontend/src/hooks/useUsgsEarthquakes.ts: Fetches USGS earthquake feed data using React Query with periodic refresh and caching.
frontend/src/hooks/useUsgsEventDetail.ts: Fetches and caches detailed USGS event data for a specific earthquake when enabled.
frontend/src/hooks/useVirtualWindow.ts: Implements a lightweight virtualization system computing visible item ranges based on scroll position.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base styles, themed color variables, dark mode settings, custom gradients, animations, and Leaflet z-index adjustments.
frontend/src/lib/earthquakeFilters.ts: Provides filtering and sorting utilities for earthquakes by time window, magnitude, and location.
frontend/src/lib/earthquakeMapBounds.ts: Filters earthquakes to those within (or slightly outside) given map bounds with date-line handling.
frontend/src/lib/earthquakeStats.ts: Computes total earthquakes, those above a threshold, and finds the largestâ€‘magnitude feature.
frontend/src/lib/fetchJson.ts: Fetches a URL and returns parsed JSON, throwing on HTTP errors.
frontend/src/lib/formatters.ts: Provides formatting helpers for timestamps, magnitude, depth, and coordinates.
frontend/src/lib/leafletTypes.ts: Defines Leaflet-related TypeScript types and utilities, including dynamic marker creation based on magnitude.
frontend/src/lib/mmi.ts: Maps MMI values to Roman numerals and labels and provides formatters for intensity.
frontend/src/lib/usgsEventDetailTypes.ts: Defines types for USGS event detail responses, including moment tensor product structures.
frontend/src/lib/usgsFeeds.ts: Builds USGS feed URLs and provides magnitude labels and color helpers.
frontend/src/lib/usgsTypes.ts: Declares core USGS GeoJSON feature and response types plus client-side filter types.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with React Query and Internet Identity providers.
frontend/src/pages/EarthquakeDashboard.t: Main dashboard component handling feed selection, filtering, stats, and table/map views.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration extending theme, colors, typography, animations, and container settings.
project_state.json: Project metadata including requirements, known issues, and architectural notes.
